note.p: Education: St Andrews University. MA. PhD (1875, Berlin)

Career: Worked in Bunsen's laboratory, Berlin; worked with Kekule in Bonn; returned to England (1878); Lecturer in Chemistry, later Assistant Professor of Chemistry, Normal School of Science, South Kensington; Professor of Chemistry, University of Aberdeen (1890); retired (1914); was a good musician
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1928 vol 118 pp iii-vi, plate, signed by J F T
